intro: Pleurothallis magalhaesii, commonly known as the Magalhães orchid, is a species native to the cloud forests of Colombia. It is a small, epiphytic orchid that thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant features delicate, lance-shaped leaves and produces fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is closely related to other Pleurothallis species. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is a subject of interest for botanists and orchid enthusiasts.
